user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of return_directory_response:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
return_directory_response (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  (void) pthread_mutex_lock (&mutex);
  if (NULL == cached_directory_response)
    ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                              MHD_HTTP_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
                              internal_error_response);
  else
    ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                              MHD_HTTP_OK,
                              cached_directory_response);
  (void) pthread_mutex_unlock (&mutex);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
(void) pthread_mutex_unlock (&mutex);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: in the shown function the pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex) call is executed on every control path — both branches of the preceding if assign ret and flow continues to the unlock and then return. There is no prior return, goto, or other construct making that statement unreachable. (A possible violation would occur if an earlier return/goto/longjmp were introduced before the unlock, making it dead code.)
